com.interpss.core.algo.impl.solver

Class DefaultNrSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.BasicNotifierImpl
      • org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl
        • org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EObjectImpl
          • com.interpss.core.algo.impl.solver.DefaultNrSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INrSolver, org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Notifier, org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject, org.eclipse.emf.ecore.InternalEObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ZbrNrSolver

    public class DefaultNrSolver
extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EObjectImpl
implements INrSolver
    InterPSS default implementation of the NR solver interface. It support non-divergent NR implementation.

      • updateBusVoltage

        public void updateBusVoltage(ISparseEqnMatrix2x2 lfEqn)
        Description copied from interface: INrSolver
        After solving the eqn [A][x] = [B], [x] is stored in [B]. Use [x] to update the AclfNetwork object update AclfNet object bus voltage using the info stored in the [B] vector of the Sparse Eqn at the end of an iteraction step.
        Specified by:
        updateBusVoltage in interface INrSolver
        Parameters:
        lfEqn - sparse equation

      • updateBusVoltage

        public void updateBusVoltage(ISparseEqnMatrix2x2 lfEqn,
                             double scaleFactor)
        Description copied from interface: INrSolver
        After solving the eqn [A][x] = [B], [x] is stored in [B]. Use [x] to update the AclfNetwork object update AclfNet object bus voltage using the info stored in the [B] vector of the Sparse Eqn at the end of an iteraction step. The scale factor is used for non-divergence Loadflow implementation.
        Specified by:
        updateBusVoltage in interface INrSolver
        Parameters:
        lfEqn - sparse equation
        scaleFactor - scale factor

      • updateBusVoltageNonDivergent

        public boolean updateBusVoltageNonDivergent(ISparseEqnMatrix2x2 lfEqn,
                                            double tolerance)
        Description copied from interface: INrSolver
        After solving the eqn [A][x] = [B], [x] is stored in [B]. Use [x] to update the AclfNetwork object. This method is for non-divergent LF implementation. It search along the [x] to find a point where mismatch is min update AclfNet object bus voltage using the info stored in the [B] vector of the Sparse Eqn and the non-divergence method at the end of an iteraction step.
        Specified by:
        updateBusVoltageNonDivergent in interface INrSolver
        Parameters:
        lfEqn - sparse equation
        tolerance - tolerance
